summary: This is a confidential internal memo from a Supervisory Staff Attorney at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York to the Warden, dated August 10, 2019. It summarizes conversations with two of Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys on August 9, 2019, regarding his housing conditions and access to water during attorney conferences, and notes the denial of requests to house him in a special unit or alone due to his pretrial status and prior suicide attempt.

events.title: Attorney Discussions on Epstein's Confinement
events.description: The Supervisory Staff Attorney holds conversations with two of Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys, Mariel Colon and Michael Miller, regarding Epstein's request for access to water during attorney conferences and inquiries about his housing conditions.

events.title: Internal Memo to Warden
events.description: A confidential memo is written by the Supervisory Staff Attorney to the Warden summarizing the previous day's conversations with Epstein's attorneys and the decisions made regarding his housing.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: On August 9, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys were actively discussing his conditions of confinement, including access to water during attorney meetings.
Prison officials denied a request to house Epstein in the 'Cadre' unit because he was a pretrial inmate.
Prison officials also denied a request to house Epstein alone in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) due to his 'prior suicide attempt/gesture'.
The memo explicitly states that, to the author's recollection, neither attorney referenced consideration for suicide watch or psychological observation during the conversations.
This document is a confidential internal communication within the Bureau of Prisons regarding a high-profile inmate less than a month before Epstein's death.
